meanings.sent1: She was cheesing with joy at the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The children were cheesing happily during the game.
meanings.sent3: Even the grumpy cat couldn't resist cheesing at the sight of the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun cheesed through the clouds, brightening up the whole sky.
meanings.sent5: His face was cheesing so much that it was contagious, making everyone around him smile too.

meanings.definition: To act in a silly or playful manner.
meanings.sent1: The clown was cheesing around, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were cheesing and giggling as they played together.
meanings.sent3: The dog started cheesing by chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The students cheesed around in the classroom, pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent5: The friends spent the afternoon cheesing around at the park, enjoying each other's company.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or exploit a situation for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: He was cheesing his way into getting a discount at the store.
meanings.sent2: The politician was cheesing to win over the voters.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was cheesing by pretending to be injured to get food from the farmer.
meanings.sent4: She was cheesing her charm to get out of doing her chores.
meanings.sent5: The salesman was cheesing his way into making a big sale by offering a special deal.
